abstract: woking high street closed for canopy demolition .
article: the controversial albion square canopy is being demolished just 10 years after it was completedbroadway and high street in woking will be closed overnight on saturday to allow the demolition of the controversial albion square canopy to continue . the demolition started on tuesday , but according to a statement from woking borough council , overnight work on saturday is necessary to ensure the work remains on schedule . the two roads will be closed up to the junction with locke way between 11 pm and 5 am with a diversion in place . the taxi rank on broadway will be relocated to outside elizabeth house , by the junction with locke way .

the work is part of a plan to create a `` welcoming pedestrianised public plaza '' between the railway station and albion house , where refurbishment work is due to finish in spring 2018 . the Â£ 4 million canopy has been in place for just 10 years , and proved controversial even before work was completed , with some residents describing it as a `` white elephant '' . the removal is set to be completed by january 15 . a spokesman for woking borough council said : `` we would like to thank road users for their patience and apologise for any inconvenience the late night works may cause to local residents . ''
